clinical_study.brief_title: Study of BN301, an Anti-CD74 Antibody Drug Conjugate, in Patients With Advanced B-Cell Malignancies
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter Phase 1/2 Clinical Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of BN301，An Anti-CD74 Antibody Drug Conjugate, in Patients With Advanced B-cell Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock: Phase 1/2 trial to study the safety, pharmacokinetics and preliminary efficacy of BN301 given intravenously every 3 weeks.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a multicenter, open-label Phase 1/2 clinical study to evaluate BN301 administered intravenously in patients with B-cell NHL who have previously failed standard therapy or who are intolerant to standard therapy. This study includes two parts: a Phase 1 dose escalation part and a Phase 2 dose expansion part. In Phase 1 and Phase 2, BN301 will be administered intravenously on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle until disease progression, intolerable toxicity, withdrawal of consent, loss to follow-up, death, or other conditions in which patients are not suitable for study treatment, whichever occurs first.
Laboratory tests will be performed weekly in Cycles 1-4 and every 3 weeks from Cycle 5 onwards (see Study Flow Chart). PK sample analysis will be performed on Days 1, 2, and 8 of the first two treatment cycles, Day 1 of the third treatment cycle, and at specified time points at the end of treatment (see Attachment 1). Additional clinical assessments and laboratory tests may be performed at discretion of the investigator as clinically indicated.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Treatment-Related Adverse Events as Assessed by CTCAE v4.0.3
Objective Response Rate of participants as assessed by the Lugano 2014 criteria.

secondary_outcome.description: Cmax of BN301 in plasma of each subject
Tmax of BN301 in plasma of each subject
Elimination half-life (t1/2) of BN301 in plasma of each subject

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve (AUC0-t)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve (AUC0-t) of BN301 in plasma of each subject
The analysis of correlation between CD74 expression and BN301 efficacy

arm_group.description: Will be administered by intravenous infusion every 3 weeks on D1
Will be administered by intravenous infusion every 3 weeks on D1
Will be administered by intravenous infusion every 3 weeks on D1

intervention.description: BN301 will be administered intravenously on Day 1 of every 21-day cycle until disease progression, intolerable toxicity, withdrawal of consent, loss to follow-up, death, or other conditions in which patients are not suitable for study treatment, whichever occurs first. Since this is the first time BN301 will be used in Chinese patients, it is planned to enroll 1 subject at the first dose level of 3.5 mg/kg.
